Text: During this National #PublicSchoolsWeek, we celebrate the public school teachers and staff who help Maryland's students succeed. We must build on the American Rescue Plan’s investments to continue student learning and support safe, healthy classrooms during #COVID19.

Welcome to Baltimore, @CIAAForLife! It’s great to have all the teams here. Good luck on day 2!
https://t.co/l6zcI8iWOG

🚨 Students, borrowers and college access professionals, tune in today at 2:00 PM for @FAFSA’s webinar on navigating the Public Service Loan Forgiveness (PSLF) program. Register: https://t.co/jiBkrMhBPi https://t.co/1L4Q3EONL5

We stand shoulder to shoulder with our allies in support of Ukraine, its people and its sovereignty. Vladimir Putin must be held accountable for rejecting diplomacy and the rule of law. This is about peace, stability and democracy worldwide.

It was a pleasure to join the Suburban Orthodox Congregation Toras Chaim’s groundbreaking celebration this weekend. The new synagogue will be a beautiful space to continue connection and learning.
https://t.co/ZtP0BAUB4G

On #NationalCaregiversDay, thank you to the many professional and family caregivers in Maryland who support those in need. We must lift up caregivers and expand access to quality, affordable child care and long-term care.

Communities of color and low-income communities have long faced disproportionate harms from pollution. I'm a cosponsor of the Environmental Justice Air Quality Monitoring Act, which will give local communities the data they need to measure and reduce pollution. https://t.co/kJGPiAs9V0

Many Marylanders have struggled to receive their unemployment benefits throughout the #COVID19 pandemic. I joined in urging @MD_Labor to apply for a new #AmericanRescuePlan program that will improve our state's unemployment insurance system.

My legislation to strengthen Chesapeake Bay restoration and environmental education has passed @NRDems! This is a crucial step to enhance the health of the Chesapeake Bay and regional economy and inspire the next generation of environmental stewards.
https://t.co/NrnKhQPwuZ
Apply for health coverage through @MarylandConnect before February 28! If you are uninsured, now is the time to sign up for high-quality, affordable coverage by visiting https://t.co/qu61alIpWf.

Maryland has seen some of the worst postal backlogs in the country. Today, I am joining @OversightDems Subcommittee on Government Operation’s hearing in Baltimore to examine these @USPS issues and how to improve services for our communities. Tune in: https://t.co/HAFB8knwEH

Last week, I voted to pass the America COMPETES Act, which fixes supply chain issues by tapping into America’s powerhouse of manufacturing and innovation. I cover a few takeaways of this comprehensive package in the latest #SarbanesStandard. 
https://t.co/Uh0DUZYvii

The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act, which I helped to pass, is delivering $9.3 million to build electric vehicle charging infrastructure throughout Maryland and create good-paying jobs by #ElectrifyingAmerica. https://t.co/zRBnn8LAAo
If you missed my telephone townhall this week, I answered your questions about what should be done to #ActOnClimate, reform #USPS and #LowerDrugPricesNow. Listen here: https://t.co/7bu2MzKQP9

Yesterday, I joined @EPAregion3 Administrator Ortiz for the announcement of a $1.8 million grant to modernize the Port of Baltimore’s infrastructure and make its equipment more energy efficient. This funding will help protect the health of our community and the environment. https://t.co/wyhuWUhtE3

@JJRJJR14 Hi @JJRJJR14, I'm sorry your tests are delayed! You should have received a USPS tracking number in your inbox. If you haven't, the USPS help line is 1-800-ASK-USPS. Please also feel free to call my office at (202) 225-4016.

I proudly voted for the #GlobalRespectAct today. By denying visas to those who commit human rights abuses against LGBTQ people, this legislation affirms that hate has no place in the United States. https://t.co/FQx5REOF0p
Great to see @BaltCoLoop off to a great start connecting the residents of Baltimore County! https://t.co/ruakYUyRbJ

Every American worker should be able to unionize for a better, fairer workplace – including here in Congress. I am cosponsoring this resolution to recognize congressional staffers’ right to unionize. https://t.co/8Ixy2cPo1O

Students should not have to fear for their safety at school - period. Standing with Catonsville High School and the community this evening. We cannot stop working to #EndGunViolence.

The bipartisan #PostalServiceReformAct will help stabilize @USPS and deliver the resources it needs to provide high-quality services. Today, I am voting to support USPS and ensure it evolves to meet Americans’ needs.

https://t.co/AIr0ytCLIi

Forced arbitration clauses silence survivors of sexual assault and harassment, blocking them from seeking justice. Today, I am voting to pass the #EndForcedArbitration Act, which will ensure that survivors can bravely make their voices heard.

In Maryland, clean water is essential to our culture, economy and public health. I joined 120 @HouseDemocrats in calling on the Biden Administration to repeal Trump’s #DirtyWaterRule and strengthen the #CleanWaterAct, which protects our streams, wetlands and drinking water.

On #WorldCancerDay, we stand with those who have been impacted by cancer. To create a future without cancer, we must #CloseTheCareGap so that all Americans have equitable access to screenings, treatment and care.

Over 850,000 people are diagnosed with heart disease each year. On this #WearRedDay, join me in raising awareness about cardiovascular diseases and the ways you can prevent them.

The disruption of #COVID19 has exposed vulnerabilities and inefficiencies in our supply chain. This week, I’ll be voting for the #AmericaCOMPETES Act to fix supply chain issues by strengthening American manufacturing and boosting our country’s innovation and competitiveness.

February is National #SHBCAwarenessMonth. School-based health centers ensure all students can receive primary care at school and remove common barriers to health services. I am proud to be a champion in Congress to bolster support for #SBHCs. https://t.co/dKu1QOjQWS

The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act is rebuilding our crumbling infrastructure. I encourage state and local officials in Maryland to visit https://t.co/Pvo6Q7Eslc for more information about this $1.2 trillion investment and upcoming funding opportunities.

Today marks the first day of #BlackHistoryMonth. Today and every day, let us celebrate the legacy and achievements of African Americans, recognize the leaders and changemakers in our community and recommit to the fight for justice and equality.
Happy #LunarNewYear! Wishing you good fortune and good health in the #YearoftheTiger. https://t.co/WZsXLmoaFK

82 years since the first #SocialSecurity check, millions of seniors and people with disabilities rely on Social Security to ensure their basic needs are met. I am a cosponsor of the Social Security 2100: A Sacred Trust Act to protect and expand benefits for years to come.

The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act will provide $17 billion nationwide to #BuildBackBetter our ports, harbors and inland waterways. This will strengthen critical supply chains, build climate resiliency and create jobs. https://t.co/VZAU6g3NCH

On #HolocaustRemembranceDay, we come together to mourn the six million Jews who perished in the Holocaust and countless others who were murdered by the Nazi regime. It is our moral obligation to remain vigilant and speak out against bigotry in all its forms.

I’m proud to cosponsor @RepSpeier and @RepManloney’s resolution recognizing the Equal Rights Amendment as the 28th Amendment to the Constitution. #ERANow has been ratified, and it’s time to guarantee constitutional protections against sex discrimination once and for all.

I’m proud that Maryland has been recognized as a @USGBC #Top10LEED state for 2021. Our state’s leadership in green building is helping to create a healthier, more sustainable future.

Every American should have access to safe abortion care. The Senate must pass the #WHPA, which I proudly supported in the House, to codify Roe v. Wade and ensure women can make the best decisions for their health and their families.

On this anniversary of #RoevWade, the fight for reproductive freedom is far from over. 49 years after the Supreme Court guaranteed the constitutional right to abortion, many states are enacting dangerous and increasingly restrictive abortion bans.

This week, the Senate had an opportunity to reverse the trend of money in politics with passage of the Freedom to Vote: John R. Lewis Act. Sadly, succumbing to the filibuster, the Senate sided with special interests over the public interest.
Twelve years ago today, the Supreme Court’s devastating decision in Citizens United unleashed wealthy donors, special interests and corporations to spend a torrent of dark money in our elections.
